committed 4a78c6eb8670cbb664a199b1c98518033e51e525
could you please close this PR
-roger
Merged.  Thanks!
Closing. Meant to do on the Uber repo this isn't ready for upstream yet.
Rebased and changed to use OptionalRequiredTest.thrift.

Thanks @radekg for this udate.

any idea about the jslint issues?

```
cd lib/js/test
make check
lib/js/test/build.xml:216: JSLint: 39 errors in 1 file
```

They might be related to the unit test issues:

```
cd lib/js/test
ant unittest
...
unittest:
     [echo] Running Unit Tests with headless browser!
     [exec] Xlib:  extension "RANDR" missing on display ":99".
     [java] Timeout: killed the sub-process
     [java] Java Result: -1
     [exec] 'waitFor()' finished in 403ms.
     [exec] Tests completed in 267 milliseconds.
     [exec] 4 assertions of 41 passed, 37 failed.
```

You can also remove ThriftTest.thrift file from this commit it is a duplication.
On it and a broader discussion here: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/THRIFT-2926
I'll review this... it's going to take a couple of days though.

Good to see these changes. I encountered some of the same issues. I hacked around for a few days and ported all the browser features to the nodejs codebase for use with browserify. There is a massive diff here, https://github.com/uber/thrift/commit/9ca44b40504cc8d45d0c1e47709128e474d991df , but I'm going to work over the next day or so to break this monolithic commit up into smaller commits capturing all the changes I made.

Hi,
this [test](https://github.com/Jimdo/thrift/commit/47278d6e66987b375200982e0218657b4c0af62d) exposes the regression.
THRIFT-2960
committed with modification to make test cases pass, thanks for the patch
@cash thanks for the pr
Related to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/THRIFT-2850
@bracki Thanks for cleaning up after my mistakes!
Merged to master https://github.com/apache/thrift/commit/9d8c1bf6f62c22c13c5b6b4da51b1de1a9d27339
Merged: a0c5ab711ef47142ca8abb55bc1d4ba139ef8129
Merged: 208738a6e34c7153908bad77210c6d194ea9d3ab

May I ask you to [create a JIRA ticket for that](thrift.apache.org/docs/HowToContribute)? 

Please Keep in mind that we want to keep Mono Support. I'm not sure if all the changes in the project files are matching that goal.

Thanks,
JensG

Many thanks for catching this. 
Could you please also provide a test case and [file a JIRA ticket](http://thrift.apache.org/docs/HowToContribute)?

Merged https://github.com/apache/thrift/commit/283899bf9a8de07522b6507dfd0f6ab70d5a7147
Thanks to @bufferoverflow

You a right: Mono 3.12.0 has no support for the Socket.DualMode property which I used in my patch. Sorry for not double checking that. As requested I opened a jira issue: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/THRIFT-3000

Thanks
sharpdevel
Can we do something with #ifdefs to protect against when it is not available?

I just gave it a shot and it doesn't compile. That's more or less what I expected, because the compiler still wants to resolve the symbol:

```
  src/Transport/TSocket.cs(64,18): error CS1061: Type `System.Net.Sockets.Socket' does
  not contain a definition for `DualMode' and no extension method `DualMode' of type 
  `System.Net.Sockets.Socket' could be found. Are you missing an assembly reference?
```
You are right. Die DualMode also has to be set using reflection. If you agree with me to head in this direction I will fix it and make another pull request - d'accord?
I don't have a better idea, so yes.
Just FYI additional commit added to PR covering review comments
this "failure" was actually a travis failure...
@pjjw From reading https://thrift.apache.org/docs/HowToContribute, looks like pull requests need to reference the JIRA ticket number?
@Magrath branch name needs to, which it does. see https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/THRIFT-3006 for upstream.
Ah, cool, hopefully it'll get merged soon then :)

@all: We have [a nice document over here](http://thrift.apache.org/docs/HowToContribute). 
Re this PR: I'm going to review this stuff soon, it's simply a matter of time. => Stay tuned :-)

no rush here, thanks!

> On Feb 25, 2015, at 4:29 PM, Jens Geyer notifications@github.com wrote:
>

> Re this PR: I'm going to review this stuff soon, it's simply a matter of time. => Stay tuned :-)
> 
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.
I'd also like to see these changes merged in. In the meantime we'll need to maintain them downstream.

Looks pretty good.  Just the one last zlib comment and I think everything will be good to go.

Thanks for putting up with my nitpicky comments :)
could you rebase to master and I commit
fixed zlib check to be  == Z_OK.  Rebased to apache/master

This needs to log the actual exceptions before throwing TApplicationException to the clients and the clients need control of where the exceptions are logged. The current design doesn't cover that. Abandoning this diff to evaluate whether that's possible.

Hello Forrest,

The Thrift project accepts pull requests but they have to be attached to a Jira Issue. If you create a Jira Issue for this here:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/THRIFT/?selectedTab=com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:issues-panel

and attach the patch someone will review it.

Best,
Randy
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/THRIFT-3040
Thanks for the initial work on this patch, closing as #213 appears to be a more complete version of this patch
hey @eevee, thanks for the work on this patch, any chance you could rebase this against the current trunk please, would like to see it make it in for THRIFT-1857
hey @romange, we do not merge changes into our branches once they have been released. If you would like to submit a patch to trunk for this issue then someone would be happy to review. Thank you
Thanks for the patch
hey @cjthompson, thanks for the patch. mind creating a ticket in our jira for this so it can be tracked and reviewed. Details are available at https://thrift.apache.org/docs/HowToContribute
Thanks for the patch @sebastianseilund, closing as #393 has a more complete patch for this and additional issues
THRIFT-2928 closed, thanks for the patch
I'm happy to pick this up if @eevee isn't around or doesn't have the time.
Feel free, @helgridly, and thanks  :)
This has been taken care of in trunk, no references to 'Thift' can be found

Same test cases from the issue run against this code:

```
compact small: 123, object
binary small: 456, object
compact: 4294967297, object
binary: 4294967297, object
compact large: Infinity, object
binary large: Infinity, object
```
Tracked in THRIFT-1125
merged as 41ad4342c5a0389ab2cf2dbf098086413ac01204. Thanks @bufferoverflow  :)

Hey Randy,

Thank you. I was having trouble building the entire test suite on my distro. I should note that the NodeJS specific tests which run with `npm test` all passed after I patched them, so there must be some missing coverage in those. Thanks for finishing this up.

Randy Abernethy  on dev@thrift.apache.org replies:
Ya, thanks for the patch!

Hope to have a reference Docker container for build/test soon to make it
easier for contribs to add value. Getting a build going from scratch can be
quite a challenge at present.
Sorry, accidentally checked in a generated file, will fix and amend the last commit.
Fixed, ready for review.
The failing test (Haskel: https://travis-ci.org/apache/thrift/jobs/56395742) seems to be unrelated to my changes.
I submitted a patch to issue THRIFT-3060.
See https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/THRIFT-2820?focusedCommentId=14389241&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-14389241 for explanation
What was that? I was about to review the patch ...

Hi Paul,
Thanks for the PR. It looks pretty good, but have you tried to remove the jQuery dependency?
As you mentioned on your comments, I also think it makes more sense if we didn't need it but I am not completely sure if you can run $http only with jqLite...

Tracked in THRIFT-3074
Please have a look at our [contribution guide](http://thrift.apache.org/docs/HowToContribute)
The build failed in an unexpected way (clang internal compiler error unrelated to the changes provided), so closing this pull request and opening another.
Going to fix some warnings at the same time.
I forgot to mention the PR in the commit message, please close it manually.
Merged as f5b795d3be6acc0da30afc4b4aa77e531125eec6 58ed1cdf3cd4da9d013e4cd4b92b3f4e440d145d
This was merged so I am closing the pull request.
The failing test (https://travis-ci.org/apache/thrift/jobs/57468277) seems to be unrelated to my changes.
@jeking3 please do not use square brackets [] around the thrift issue identifer, this will be removed when I use git am toi apply the patch.

Thanks Simon!
just committed this, please check this for the next PR
https://thrift.apache.org/docs/HowToContribute

@bufferoverflow Thanks for the heads up, if that is in the process documentation for submitting requests I missed it.  I'll remove the brackets in my pull requests.  Does that apply to the pull request title or to the git commit comments or both?
Closing as the code has been merged into the project.
The code has been merged so I am closing the pull request.
There was no conflict with master however I need to base THRIFT-3083 on top of these changes so I needed to refresh it.
Build failed though no fault of my own, so closing this and opening a new one.

All of the concerns I have with this request are minor.  Once these are fixed, I give it a +1.  Note that the out-of-line destructor comment applies to the other destructors that got inlined.

I will not personally be able to do the commit for another week or two, but if someone else is able to (after these fixes), then I will be much appreciative.

Again, just minor issues.  +1 after they get fixed.

As with the THRIFT-2441 review, avoid inlined virtual dtors.  Try to scrub all the 'concurrency::' usages.

Okay this one is ready for re-review now.  I'll remind folks that this change and THRIFT-2441 have an interaction, so whichever one is merged first, I will need to refresh the other to line up with it.  The changes are minor, mostly in stop() being moved to the .cpp file(s).

I am going to prepare for this by merging THRIFT-3081 on top of THRIFT-2441 locally so I can re-submit once THRIFT-2441 is merged in, therefore I would request that THRIFT-2441 get merged in first to optimize this process.  Thanks!

As part of work on THRIFT-3084 I added a TServer integration test, and found that the shutdown behavior and the rules for when you can call setInterruptableChildren() had to be tightened up for a couple cases.  I am going to close this pull request until this is resolved so that it doesn't get merged in until the test passes.
Added an integration test to prove behavior is correct; re-opening for CI build.
Closing and reopening because three builds failed with "build.ninja not found".  Seems unrelated to changes made.
Nevermind, it is my fault - fixing it..
Wow, this really isn't my morning...
Build failed in an unrelated way so I closed and re-opened to kick a new build.
Hi @gwax, thanks for the patch. Can you please create a jira issue for this so we can better track your contribution. details available here: http://thrift.apache.org/docs/HowToContribute
I have added the relevant (existing) Jira issue to the description. Is that sufficient or should I do something further?
perfect, thanks
I guess this was merged through Hudson, as a result I am closing this.  Sometimes they close automatically, and sometimes they do not, and I have no idea why...

> . Sometimes they close automatically, and sometimes they do not, and I have no idea why...

They are closed when the magic line `This closes <number>` is in the commit message. If the committer does not add this (or forgets it) then nothing happens.
Are we using the github "merge pull request" mechanism that appears in each pull request here, or are we forced to use some other means to commit changes?
https://thrift.apache.org/docs/committers/HowToCommit
Thanks - the manual steps in this process are less than ideal, and Apache should consider tighter integration to resolve.
